text: Norton Juster (June 2, 1929 â€“ March 8, 2021) was an American academic, architect, and writer. He was best known as an author of children's books, notably for The Phantom Tollbooth and The Dot and the Line. Juster died on March 8, 2021, at his home in Northampton, Massachusetts from problems caused by a stroke, aged 91. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Academics from Massachusetts Category:American architects Category:Writers from New York City Category:Businesspeople from New York City
title: Norton Juster
